Bounty, that currently has 30 brands onboard, is tapping into brands' growing interest in small creators.

174.title: Haryana Congress MLA Kuldeep Bishnoi resigns, set to join BJP
174.article_body: Congress leader and Haryana MLA from Adampur constituency Kuldeep Bishnoi on Wednesday handed his resignation letter to the state Assembly Speaker. "We need to strengthen work done by CM Manohar Lal Khattar. We should give good message even to BJP that popular leader is joining the party," he said earlier. Bishnoi is set to join BJP on Thursday.

175.title: ED attaches 2 builders' assets worth ₹415 crore in 'India's biggest bank fraud'
175.article_body: Enforcement Directorate has attached assets worth ₹415 crore from builders Sanjay Chhabria and Avinash Bhosale, who were arrested in the Yes Bank-DHFL case that caused an alleged loss of ₹34,000 crore to a consortium of 17 banks. It is being called India's biggest bank fraud. The attached assets included land parcels and flats in Mumbai and high-end luxury cars.

176.title: Kansas voters block effort to ban abortions in state constitution
176.article_body: Voters in US state of Kansas on Tuesday rejected a constitutional amendment that would have declared that there is no right to abortion. Kansas is the first state to hold a referendum on abortion after US Supreme Court overturned Roe vs Wade in June, a ruling that granted abortion rights to women.

177.title: Pic of actress Pranitha sitting at husband's feet for ritual sparks debate, she responds
177.article_body: An image of actress Pranitha Subhash sitting at her husband's feet for a ritual has sparked a debate, with some social media users raising questions about patriarchy. "Just because I'm an actor...doesn't mean...I cannot follow a ritual that I...completely believe in," she responded. "One can be forward thinking and modern, but that doesn't mean one forgets one's roots," said Pranitha.

178.title: Did not take adult scenes from 'Forrest Gump' in 'Laal...': Aamir Khan
178.article_body: Actor Aamir Khan has said a few changes have been made to 'Laal Singh Chaddha' from the original film 'Forrest Gump' to "suit the sensibilities of the Indian audiences". "The Hollywood film had a few adult scenes, we did not take those in our film," he added. Aamir said he wanted people to watch the film with their families.

179.title: FSSAI starts nationwide drive to check adulteration in edible oils
179.article_body: To check adulteration in edible oils and the presence of trans-fatty acids in hydrogenated oils, the Food Safety and Standards Authority of India (FSSAI) has launched a nationwide campaign. The campaign, which will end on August 14, will also crack down on the sale of loose edible oil and multi-source edible oils without proper labelling across the country.

180.title: Got 1st film while asleep, wouldn't get films later even by running: Pankaj
180.article_body: Actor Pankaj Tripathi said he got his first film while he was sleeping, adding he wouldn't get movies even by running after that. "Someone told them, 'An actor is sleeping over there, he has decent comic timing'...They...woke me up. I asked them, 'Who're you?'" added Pankaj. "I was like, 'What kind of a man is he?'" he stated.

181.title: Nintendo Switch sales fall 22% to 3.43 million units in Q1
181.article_body: Japan's Nintendo said on Wednesday that it sold 22% fewer Switch consoles in the quarter ended June compared with the corresponding period in the previous fiscal. The gaming company sold 3.43 million units of the console as against 4.45 million in the year-ago period. The company is forecasting a fall in the annual sale of the Switch devices this year.

182.title: Srikanth was so distraught, it was painful to watch him cry: Satwik on losing CWG final
182.article_body:
After India lost mixed badminton team final at CWG 2022, Satwiksairaj Rankireddy said, 
"[Kidambi] Srikanth anna was so distraught...But it's not just his mistake though he's blaming himself. Even I lost a match." He added, "It was painful to watch him cry." Srikanth lost his singles match in the final, while Satwiksairaj and Chirag Shetty lost the men's doubles match.

183.title: I was expecting bronze, had goosebumps while collecting silver medal: Vikas
183.article_body: Indian weightlifter Vikas Thakur, who won the silver medal in the men's 96-kg category at CWG 2022, has said he was expecting a bronze medal as the competition was "tough". He added, "I gave my best and won silver...Had goosebumps (while collecting the medal)...I dedicate the medal to my mother." Indian weightlifters have won eight medals so far.

184.title: No Oppn MP participated in 'Tiranga bike rally': BJP's Amit Malviya
184.article_body: No Opposition MP chose to participate in the 'Tiranga bike rally’ which was flagged off from the Red Fort on Wednesday, BJP leader Amit Malviya said. "Is this an unequivocal admission that BJP is the sole custodian of the Tiranga, a symbol of our national pride?" Malviya tweeted. The 'Tiranga bike rally' was organised today for MPs of all parties.

185.title: Sun Pharma Chairman Israel Makov to retire on August 29
185.article_body: Sun Pharmaceutical Industries on Wednesday said its Chairman Israel Makov will retire from the company on August 29. Makov has led the Mumbai-based pharma major for 10 years. "Makov has played a significant role in the company's global expansion...He guided the company into its next phase of growth with focus on innovation," Sun Pharma MD Dilip Shanghvi said.

186.title: It's all because of you: Chris Pratt on 8 yrs of 'Guardians of...'
186.article_body: Hollywood actor Chris Pratt took to Instagram after 'Guardians of the Galaxy' completed eight years of its release. The film had released on August 1, 2014, in the United States. "I'm constantly blown away by the community we've built in the past eight years! And it's all because of YOU," Chris wrote. The film was directed by James Gunn.

187.title: Pune Police arrest 4 for snatching gold chains during Palkhi processions
187.article_body: The crime branch of Pune Police arrested four men on Monday for snatching gold chains and robbing devotees during Palkhi processions in Pune and Pimpri-Chinchwad. Police also recovered 24 tola gold ornaments worth ₹12,24,000 and two mobile phones worth ₹1,30,000 from the accused. According to police, the accused used to sell the stolen ornaments in Ahmednagar district.

188.title: Chandigarh Police arrests drunk man for brandishing 'weapon' while driving
188.article_body: A 23-year-old inebriated man was arrested by police for allegedly brandishing a "weapon", which was later found to be a dummy gun, while overspeeding near Chandigarh’s Nexus Elante Mall. On receiving information on Monday night, police stopped the man for checking when they found out that the weapon in the car was a dummy. After examination, he was found drunk.

189.title: Sri Lanka to restart IMF bailout talks in Aug: Prez Wickremesinghe
189.article_body: Sri Lanka's new President Ranil Wickremesinghe told Parliament on Wednesday that the country will restart bailout talks with International Monetary Fund (IMF) in August. He also called on lawmakers to form an all-party government to resolve a crippling economic crisis. Wickremesinghe took office last month after his predecessor Gotabaya Rajapaksa fled the country and quit following mass protests.

190.title: Rupee falls 27 paise to 78.80 against US dollar in early trade
190.article_body: The rupee fell 27 paise to 78.80 against the US dollar in opening trade on Wednesday. The rupee opened at 78.70 against the US dollar at the interbank foreign exchange, then declined to 78.80, registering a fall of 27 paise over the last close of 78.53 on Tuesday. Meanwhile, the dollar index fell by 0.07% to 106.16.

191.title: Traffic to be affected in Mumbai's Western Express Highway, Malabar Hill
191.article_body: Traffic movement is expected to be slow on Western Express Highway and Malabar Hill on Wednesday morning due to scheduled VVIP visit, the Mumbai Police said. "Traffic is likely to be slow between Santacruz Airport, WEH to Malabar Hill from 10:30 am to 11:30 am and Malabar Hill to Regal Circle from 12:30 pm to 06:00 pm," the police tweeted.

192.title: 'The Kashmir...', 'Bhool...' worked: Aamir on claims of B'wood films not working
192.article_body: Aamir Khan reacted to claims that Bollywood films are not doing well. "I don't see a shift. Historically, the films aren't good, people don't like them...People like films that are nice," he stated. Aamir added, "Now, people are liking Allu Arjun's 'Pushpa', Anupam Kher's 'The Kashmir Files' and Alia Bhatt's 'Gangubai Kathiawadi' so it's working. Recently...'Bhool Bhulaiyaa 2' also worked...well."

193.title: 9-yr-old drowns in pit created by construction work in Gurugram
193.article_body: A nine-year-old boy allegedly drowned to death in Gurugram in a water-filled pit created by construction work on the Dwarka Expressway in Sector 109, police said. The incident took place when the victim went to bathe in the pit with a few friends on Monday evening. His friends got scared and fled from the spot after he drowned, police added.

194.title: Ruchira Kamboj takes charge as India's 1st woman UN envoy, says 'All girls can make it'
194.article_body: Ambassador Ruchira Kamboj on Tuesday took charge as India's first woman envoy to the UN in New York and presented her credentials to UN Secretary-General Antonio Guterres. She tweeted, "A privilege to be the first Indian woman to be given the honour to hold this position. To the girls out there, we all can make it!"

195.title: Rahul changes profile pic to Nehru holding Tiranga amid BJP's campaign
195.article_body: Rahul Gandhi has changed his Twitter profile photo to India's first PM Jawaharlal Nehru holding national flag, a day after PM Narendra Modi asked Indians to put national flag as profile picture as part of the 'Har Ghar Tiranga' campaign. "The tricolour is the country's pride. It is in the heart of every citizen," Rahul Gandhi tweeted.

196.title: Europe's largest nuclear plant in Ukraine out of control: UN nuclear chief
196.article_body: Europe's largest nuclear power plant in Ukraine "is completely out of control", UN nuclear watchdog International Atomic Energy Agency (IAEA) chief Rafael Grossi warned. "Every principle of nuclear safety has been violated" at the Zaporizhzhia plant, which Russian troops seized in March, Grossi said, urging Russia and Ukraine to allow experts to visit the complex to avoid a nuclear accident.

197.title: India under leadership of PM Modi has given us a breath of life: Sri Lanka President
197.article_body: Expressing gratitude towards PM Narendra Modi and people of India, newly elected Sri Lankan President Ranil Wickremesinghe on Wednesday said, "Government of India under the leadership of PM Modi has given us a breath of life." "I wish to specially mention the assistance provided by India, our closest neighbour, in our efforts for economic revitalisation," Wickremesinghe added.

198.title: Daughter Palak Tiwari is too busy to meet me: Raja Chaudhary
198.article_body: Actor Raja Chaudhary, speaking about his daughter Palak Tiwari, has said that he does not get a chance to meet her. "I message or email her and wait for her reply...Maybe she is too busy or maybe she is ignoring me," he added. Palak is Raja's daughter from his marriage with ex-wife and actress Shweta Tiwari.

199.title: TRS MP Nageswara Rao's son robbed at knifepoint in Hyderabad, 2 arrested
199.article_body: The son of TRS MP N Nageswara Rao was robbed of ₹75,000 at knifepoint in Hyderabad, police said. The incident occurred on July 30 when two men on bike asked Rao's son Prithvi to stop his car and got into the vehicle. They then forced Prithvi to transfer money online, police said, adding that the two were later arrested.

200.title: People said 'shadi kab hui, bachha kab hua', to hell with that kind of thinking: Alia
200.article_body: Speaking on her pregnancy, Alia Bhatt said, "There were a few who said, 'Shadi kab hui, bachha kab hua'." Bhatt said, "Women are always questioned and are constantly battling things as if it's their fault." She added, "I'd like to say to hell with that kind of thinking. We're in 2022 and people should start living like they're in 2022."

201.title: Really pains me when women have to bear being beaten, depression: Alia
201.article_body: Actress Alia Bhatt said it "really pains" her when women have to bear ridiculous situations like being beaten or feeling depressed. "It pains me to see that...a lot of women still think there is no way out of a bad marriage," added Alia. "For women, like the one I play in 'Darlings', the idea of divorce is impossible," she stated.

202.title: I should be okay by the weekend: Rohit on retiring hurt in 3rd WI T20I
202.article_body: India captain Rohit Sharma, who had retired hurt on 11 after suffering a back spasm while chasing WI's 165-run target in the third T20I, has said he should be "okay" by the weekend. Talking about the match, Rohit said, "We used the conditions and our variations really well...[our chase] was quite clinical." The fourth T20I will be played on Saturday.

203.title: 6-km jam on Pune-Bengaluru highway as thousands gather for Siddaramaiah's birthday
203.article_body: Karnataka's Davanagere district witnessed a six-kilometre-long traffic jam on the Pune-Bengaluru highway as thousands of people gathered for the 75th birthday celebrations of former Karnataka CM Siddaramaiah. "I would like to appeal to those who come to Davanagere...to drive carefully and not in undue haste," Siddaramaiah tweeted. Notably, one person going to Davanagere died in a road accident.

204.title: Militant group claims responsibility for downing Pak army helicopter
204.article_body: Baloch Raaji Aajoi Sangar (BRAS) on Tuesday claimed responsibility for targeting and downing a military helicopter, which went missing on Monday. All six people on board the helicopter, including a senior commander, were killed. However, the Pakistan army said that the helicopter had crashed on a mountain during a flood relief operation in Balochistan province due to bad weather.

205.title: US sues state of Idaho for near-absolute ban on abortion
205.article_body: The US sued the state of Idaho for imposing a "near-absolute ban" on abortion. According to US Justice Department, the ban would criminalise doctors who provide medical services approved by federal law. Idaho's abortion ban was coming into effect  in the aftermath of US Supreme Court's decision to overturn landmark ruling Roe vs Wade.

206.title: Man forcibly castrated, jailed for 25yrs for raping 8-yr-old stepdaughter in Kazakhstan
206.article_body: A man has been castrated for raping his eight-year-old stepdaughter, with a court in Kazakhstan sentencing him to 25 years in jail. The judge ordered him to undergo 'forcible chemical castration'. The convict, who had been married four times, subjected the girl to three years of abuse starting from when she was five, the court was informed.

207.title: CAA is our commitment, we'll do it: Bengal BJP chief
207.article_body: Bengal BJP chief Sukanta Majumdar said that CAA is core issue for Bengal BJP, the way Ram Mandir was an issue for All India BJP. "CAA is our commitment, we'll do it...People are forced to come because of atrocities committed on Hindus," he added. On Tuesday, Home Minister Amit Shah said that CAA will be implemented after COVID vaccine drive.

208.title: Uber sells 7.8% stake in Zomato for $392 million: Reports
208.article_body: Uber Technologies on Wednesday sold its 7.8% stake in Zomato for $392 million via a block deal on local exchanges, according to reports. The stake was reportedly bought by around 20 global and Indian funds, including Fidelity, Franklin Templeton and ICICI Prudential. The Zomato block deal was executed at ₹50.44 per share, the reports added.

209.title: GST Council a rubber stamp, we opposed hike: TN Finance Minister
209.article_body: Tamil Nadu Finance Minister P Thiaga Rajan on Wednesday said that the GST Council is a "rubber stamp". "We sent a written submission that we opposed the hike...We have the most complex GST model among 140 countries with thousands of flaws," Rajan added. "It operates with lack of meetings…It is anything but federalism," he stated.

210.title: Rohit, Dravid have given players more freedom, security: Hardik Pandya
210.article_body: India all-rounder Hardik Pandya has praised captain Rohit Sharma and head coach Rahul Dravid for making the players feel "secure" in the team. "Players are not looking over their shoulder; [Rohit and Dravid are] making sure [players] are getting ample chances; they're getting told as well if they are not playing and that is something which is commendable," explained Hardik.

211.title: Kerala's Aluva Mahadeva Temple submerges amid heavy rain; red alert in 3 districts
211.article_body: Kochi's Aluva Mahadeva Temple got submerged as the water level in the Periyar river continued to rise amid heavy rains in Kerala. India Meteorological Department issued a 'red' alert for Kottayam, Idukki and Ernakulam and an 'orange' alert for eight other districts. As many as 12 people lost their lives in different rain-related incidents in Kerala since Sunday, officials said.

212.title: Mahua had a flourishing corporate career: Swara Bhasker on TMC MP's '₹1.5 lakh bag'
212.article_body: Actress Swara Bhasker has said that it did not seem like TMC MP Mahua Moitra was trying to hide her branded bag during a debate on inflation in the Parliament. Swara tweeted, "She had a flourishing corporate career and bought branded items with her own hard earned money. Haw! How 'controversial'." Reports claimed the bag was priced over ₹1.5 lakh.

213.title: He's in form of his life, don't tinker: Shastri on Suryakumar opening
213.article_body: Ravi Shastri said batter Suryakumar Yadav should be asked to bat at the number he'll bat in the T20 World Cup 2022, having opened in the T20Is against West Indies. "Let him go in different situations, maybe two wickets down early...Suryakumar's in the form of his life at that middle-order position," he added. "Don't tinker around," he stated.

214.title: Pune airport will be built at original site in Purandar: CM Shinde
214.article_body: Maharashtra CM Eknath Shinde stated that the proposed airport in Pune will be constructed at the earlier site identified in Purandar tehsil by the then Devendra Fadnavis government. Shinde further said land acquisition for the airport will not be done forcefully. "First, we'll acquire...land from those who are ready to give. Simultaneously, we'll start...discussion with other farmers," he added.

215.title: People said, 'What if people laugh on your performance': Sunil on doing different roles
215.article_body: Sunil Grover, in an interview, was asked if his comic characters impacted his chances of getting different roles. To this, he replied, "Maybe I have been lucky that people have accepted my male characters apart from comedy." "It has happened sometimes that people said, 'You have a funny image, what if people laugh on your performance'," he added.

216.title: India risen from slumber, moving towards becoming 'great' power: Amit Shah
216.article_body: Home Minister Amit Shah on Tuesday urged people to participate in 'Har Ghar Tiranga' campaign and tell world that India has "risen from slumber". Shah added India is swiftly moving forward and is heading towards becoming a "great" power. He was addressing an event held to celebrate the legacy of freedom fighter Pingali Venkayya, who also designed the Indian flag.

217.title: Author Civic Chandran granted anticipatory bail in sexual assault case
217.article_body: A Kerala court granted anticipatory bail to author Civic Chandran in a sexual assault case, the complaint of which was lodged by a woman writer in July. He had allegedly sexually harassed her during a book exhibition in Kozhikode in April. Another woman filed a sexual harassment case against Chandran for allegedly making sexual advances during an exhibition in 2020.

218.title: Russia declares Ukraine's Azov Regiment as a terrorist group
218.article_body: Russian Supreme Court designated Ukraine's Azov Regiment as a terrorist organisation on Tuesday. At least 1,000 soldiers of Azov Regiment, which was formed in 2014 as a paramilitary group to fight pro-Russian rebels, are held by Russia in eastern Ukraine. Azov called upon Washington to declare Russia a terrorist state, claiming it is looking for new justifications for war crimes.

219.title: What actions has China taken against Taiwan over US House Speaker Pelosi's visit?
219.article_body: After US House Speaker Nancy Pelosi visited Taiwan, Chinese army announced drills and missile test launches encircling Taiwan. Earlier, Chinese media said the country launched joint navy and air force exercises around Taiwan. China announced suspending imports of citrus fruits, chilled white striped hairtail and frozen horse mackerel and export of natural sand. China also summoned US' ambassador.

220.title: US CHIPS bill offers chance for US-Taiwan cooperation: Pelosi
220.article_body: US House Speaker Nancy Pelosi told the Taiwanese Parliament on Wednesday that the CHIPS bill would offer a good opportunity to US and Taiwan for cooperation in the chip industry. The bill was passed in US Senate and House of Representatives and will now be signed by US President Joe Biden. Pelosi called for more parliamentary exchange with Taiwan.

221.title: Dinesh Karthik is 'not' a finisher: Ex-India batter Kris Srikkanth
221.article_body: Ex-India batter Kris Srikkanth said Dinesh Karthik cannot be termed as a finisher, adding a finisher is a player who can take the match from the eighth or ninth over and finish it. "What Karthik is doing can be called final touches...Hardik Pandya, Rishabh Pant are finishers...and...Rohit Sharma [who] can...play till...17th over in 12th gear is also [one]," he stated.

222.title: Why is Ashwin in WI T20 series? I’m confused: Kris Srikkanth
222.article_body: Ex-Chairman of BCCI's selection committee Kris Srikkanth has questioned Ravichandran Ashwin's place in India's squad for the ongoing WI T20Is. "Why was [Ashwin] not playing the T20Is in England and then suddenly why is he in the T20Is for the WI? It's confusing...your first spinner is Jadeja...[and second should be] Chahal because he is the wrist spinner," stated Srikkanth.

223.title: Police to issue challans to 2-wheelers entering Delhi-Meerut Expressway
223.article_body: The Ghaziabad Traffic Police is likely to start issuing challans to two and three-wheelers for entering expressway lanes of the Delhi-Meerut Expressway (DME), officials said. The DME has three inside lanes on each side designated as expressway lanes where entry of two and three-wheelers are not allowed. The violators will be penalised with ₹20,000 fine, a traffic police official said.

224.title: US Senate passes bill to help veterans exposed to toxic burn pits
224.article_body: US Senate passed a bill that aims to strengthen health care for veterans exposed to burn pits. The bill, passed with 86-11 votes, will allow veterans to receive disability payments to compensate for their illness without having to prove that it was a result of their service. The bill was passed in June but was delayed due to technical error.

225.title: I'm looking for more medals: Sharath after men's table tennis team's gold
225.article_body: Indian table tennis player Sharath Kamal said he's targeting more medals after the gold medal in the men's table tennis team event at CWG 2022. "I'm looking for more medals in singles, doubles and mixed...It's the first time I've defended a title and we've done it very well," added Sharath. "This gold builds a lot of confidence," he stated.

226.title: Oppn wasn't targeted like this even during Emergency: Shiv Sena on Raut's arrest
226.article_body: After Shiv Sena MP Sanjay Raut was arrested by the ED, the party on Tuesday said such targeting of Opposition didn't take place even during the Emergency imposed by the then PM Indira Gandhi. "People in power have decided to chop off the tongues or strangle those who speak the truth," the Shiv Sena said in its mouthpiece 'Saamana'.

227.title: BMC links Tansa Main with BPT line, several areas to face water cut tomorrow
227.article_body: Several parts of Mumbai, including the Mumbai International Airport, Bandra Terminus and areas across Dharavi will get no water supply on Thursday. The water supply will be hit because the Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) has undertaken work on connecting Tansa Main with BPT (Break Pressure Tunnel) line. The work will be carried out from 10 am till 12 midnight.

228.title: 25-yr-old detainee escapes jail after ripping out toilet in Belgium
228.article_body: A 25-year-old man escaped a detention cell in Belgium after ripping out its toilet, police said on Tuesday. The escapee reportedly "unhooked the toilet from the wall" and slipped out "through a hole no larger than an A4 sheet of paper". From that hole, he allegedly landed into an underground corridor and climbed out of a window onto the street.

229.title: Oil prices fall ahead of OPEC+ supply meeting today
229.article_body: Ahead of the meeting of the Organization of Petroleum Exporting Countries (OPEC)+ on Wednesday, oil prices slipped with the WTI for September delivery falling below $94 a barrel on the New York Mercantile Exchange in Singapore. Brent for October settlement slipped to $99.71 a barrel on the ICE Futures Europe exchange. US crude stockpiles expanded by over 2 million barrels.

230.title: Power of a vision: Goyal on India being home to 75,000 startups
230.article_body: Taking to Twitter, Union Commerce and Industry Minister Piyush Goyal on Wednesday said, "India is now home to 75,000 startups in the 75th year of Independence and this is only the beginning.'' He further said, "These numbers tell the power of a vision.'' Goyal had recently said that the country aspires to become the world's largest startup ecosystem.

231.title: High-level inquiry ordered, will see if Andhra gas leak was random or deliberate: Min
231.article_body: Andhra Pradesh Minister of Industries Gudivada Amarnath on Wednesday said that a high-level inquiry has been ordered into the suspected gas leak incident at a company in Anakapalle district. "It remains to be determined whether it was a random or a deliberate act," he added. "The samples have been sent to ICMR for further inquiry," Amarnath further said.

232.title: Trolls can't stop a good film: Milind Soman on 'boycott Laal...' Twitter trend
232.article_body: Taking to Twitter, actor Milind Soman has reacted to the 'boycott Laal Singh Chaddha' Twitter trend. "Trolls can't stop a good film," Milind tweeted. Earlier, actor Aamir Khan, who stars in 'Laal Singh Chaddha', reacted to the trend and said, "I feel sad...because many people who are saying this, in their hearts, believe I'm someone who doesn't like India."

233.title: T'gana encourages oil palm cultivation to cut vegetable oil import: Reports
233.article_body: Telangana is encouraging farmers to shift to oil palms as it is targeting two million additional acres for their cultivation over the next four years, a Reuters report said. This could reduce India's vegetable oil import which was $18.9 billion a year ago. India imports nearly 14 million tonnes of vegetable oil annually to meet two-thirds of its demand.

234.title: Taiwan military raises alertness level as China announces live-fire drills
234.article_body: Taiwan's cabinet said the military has increased its alertness level and authorities will make plans to ensure safety and stability around the island. This comes after China announced a series of military exercises, including live-fire drills, encircling Taiwan in response to US House Speaker Nancy Pelosi's Taiwan visit. The cabinet added that citizens should feel reassured about their security.

235.title: Govt lists dos and don'ts to avoid contracting monkeypox
235.article_body: The government has listed dos and don'ts to avoid contracting monkeypox. The government asked people to isolate infected patients, wash hands with soap and water and wear masks and gloves near infected patients. The government warned against sharing linen and bedding with infected patients, washing clothes of infected and non-infected persons together and going into public if one has symptoms.

236.title: The film industry can mess with your mental health: Tanishaa Mukerji
236.article_body: Actress Tanishaa Mukerji said it's "very important" to enter the film industry with strong backing and go in front of the camera "with a strong sense of self". "The industry can...mess with your mental health because no matter...how successful you are, people will tell you how you should be," she added. Tanishaa made her Bollywood debut with 'Sssshhh...'.

237.title: Was important to bat deep, we saw what happened in 2nd T20I: Suryakumar
237.article_body: India's Suryakumar Yadav said it was important for someone to bat 15-17 overs after Rohit Sharma retired hurt on 11 after suffering a back spasm while chasing WI's 165-run target. "[In the second T20I]...we saw what happened...it was important for someone to bat deep," stated Suryakumar. Brandon King had helped WI to chase down India's 139-run target in second T20I.

238.title: Rohit breaks Kohli's record for smashing most sixes in T20I cricket as India captain
238.article_body: Rohit Sharma on Tuesday broke Virat Kohli's record for smashing the most number of sixes in T20I cricket as India captain. With his sole six in the third T20I against West Indies, Rohit took his tally of sixes as captain in T20I cricket to 60. Kohli had slammed 59 sixes as captain in T20Is.

239.title: SRK sang the entire song, explained the meaning: Bhardwaj on 'La Ilaaj'
239.article_body: Discussing the song 'La Ilaaj' from Alia Bhatt-starrer 'Darlings', director and the movie's music composer Vishal Bhardwaj said, "Shah Rukh Khan called me one night around 12-12.30 am...[and] sang the entire song." "He said, 'It would have been more fun had the song been for me'...I felt so nice," added Bhardwaj. Bhardwaj stated that SRK even narrated the song's meaning.

240.title: Sub-inspector on patrol duty stabbed in Secunderabad, case registered
240.article_body: A sub-inspector of Hyderabad's Marredpally police station suffered injuries after he was stabbed by a person in Secunderabad. The incident took place late on Tuesday night when Sub-Inspector A Vinay Kumar was on patrol duty. According to reports, Kumar had questioned two suspicious persons in a drunken state following which one of them stabbed him in his abdomen.

241.title: Seema Punia misses medal by 1.07m in women's discus throw at CWG 2022
241.article_body: Indian discus throwers Seema Punia and Navjeet Kaur Dhillon finished fifth and eighth respectively in the women's discus throw final at the CWG 2022 on Tuesday. Punia's best throw of 55.92m in her six attempts was 1.07m short of Nigeria's Obiageri Amaechi's bronze medal-winning throw of 56.99m. Navjeet produced a best throw of 53.51m in the final.

242.title: Maharashtra MLA Uday Samant's car attacked in Pune, 5 arrested
242.article_body: Pune Police arrested five persons in connection with the attack on Maharashtra's Ratnagiri MLA Uday Samant's car on Tuesday. The vehicle of Samant, an MLA from Shiv Sena's Eknath Shinde faction, was attacked by some people with baseball sticks and stones. "CM Shinde's convoy was ahead of me. Police will investigate whether they were following me or CM," Samant said.

243.title: 8-yr-old girl dies in Bengaluru after inhaling pesticide fumes
243.article_body: An eight-year-old girl died after suspected pesticide poisoning on Tuesday at Bengaluru's Vasanth Nagar. The incident occurred after the family returned to their rented house in Bengaluru where painting and pest control was done a few days back. All three members of the family felt breathing difficulties and rushed to hospital. The eight-year-old died while undergoing treatment.

244.title: Which 10 states have the most active COVID-19 cases as India reports 17,135 new cases?
244.article_body: India has reported 17,135 COVID-19 cases and 47 deaths in the last 24 hours including 12 reconciled deaths in Kerala. India's active COVID-19 cases stood at 1,37,057, while the death toll reached 5,26,477. Kerala has the maximum active cases in the country at 13,177, followed by Maharashtra with 12,583 active cases and West Bengal with 12,254 active cases.

245.title: Sharath would cry on the phone: Brother on his hamstring injury in 2015
245.article_body: Following India's gold medal in the men's table tennis team event at CWG 2022, Rajath Kamal, who is the brother of table tennis player Sharath Kamal said Sharath was "quite depressed" after his hamstring injury in 2015. "It was his toughest test. He...had to take complete bed rest...He used to call us and cry on the phone," added Rajath.

246.title: Our people suffered, what was happening in govt was intolerable: Maha CM
246.article_body: Maharashtra CM Eknath Shinde on Tuesday said after the MVA government was formed, people used to visit him because "some people" had no time to meet them. "Our people suffered, what was happening in the government was intolerable," CM Shinde added. "Government came to power and our party chief became Chief Minister. We all got down to work," he stated.

247.title: One of the best feelings: Akshay Kumar on reports of being India's highest taxpayer
247.article_body: Akshay Kumar has said that he has been told he is the highest taxpayer in India, adding, "It's one of the best feelings." He said, "I'm really honoured. It feels great that the Income Tax Department recognises the whole thing and gives credit to people. Also, It's good that when you earn, you give back to the country."

248.title: Farmers call off proposed protest after Punjab CM accepts demands
248.article_body: The farmer bodies on Tuesday called off their proposed protest scheduled for Wednesday after Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann accepted most of their demands. Sugarcane dues stand at ₹195.60 crore and out of which ₹100 crore will be paid by August 15, CM said. "We have decided to cancel the FIRs registered against farmers for stubble burning and agitation," Mann added.

249.title: Heavy rains cause waterlogging, traffic jams in Bengaluru
249.article_body: Heavy rains lashed Bengaluru on Tuesday, causing waterlogging and traffic jams in several parts of the city. Over 50 vehicles were damaged by water on roads and two-wheelers were stuck in the middle of the road. Several low-lying areas like Sai Layout and Yelachenahalli were inundated. According to the IMD, Bengaluru is likely to receive heavy rainfall on Wednesday.

250.title: VP Naidu flags off 'Tiranga bike rally' for all MPs from Red Fort
250.article_body: Vice President and Rajya Sabha Chairman M Venkaiah Naidu on Wednesday morning flagged off the 'Tiranga bike rally' from the Red Fort for the MPs of all parties. The rally will culminate at Vijay Chowk near the Parliament. Union Minister Pralhad Joshi on Tuesday said that the rally has been organised by the Culture Ministry and not the BJP.

251.title: US House Speaker Pelosi meets Taiwan President Tsai Ing-wen
251.article_body: US House Speaker Nancy Pelosi met Taiwanese President Tsai Ing-wen on Wednesday. Tsai thanked Pelosi for her support of democratic values and voiced her commitment to working with the US on security in the Taiwan straits and Indo-Pacific region. Tsai also promised economic cooperation with US. Pelosi has become the highest ranking US official to visit Taiwan in 25 years.

252.title: You walked out the moment I said paneer had VAT in Bengal: Sitharaman to TMC MP
252.article_body: After TMC MP Derek O'Brien said that Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman evaded their issues on price rise and GST in Parliament, she tweeted, "You just walked out the moment I said in W. Bengal, pre-GST, paneer had a VAT on it." She added that she replied on every issue raised by the TMC MP including cesses, LPG, GST and rupee.

253.title: Morale went down when SA levelled but didn't lose hope: Saikia on gold
253.article_body: Nayanmoni Saikia, who's a member of India's women's fours lawn bowls team that won the gold medal at CWG 2022, said, "Our morale went a little down when South Africa levelled 1-1 [in the final]." "We didn't lose hope. We talked...and understood...we can do it," she added. Nayanmoni's teammate Rupa Rani Tirkey said they'd never thought of winning the gold.

254.title: Video of Ashneer Grover's lookalike at a 'kirtan' goes viral; he responds
254.article_body: A video of BharatPe's ex-MD Ashneer Grover's lookalike at a kirtan in Vrindavan's ISKCON temple went viral on social media. Sharing the video on Twitter, Grover wrote, "Hey doppelgänger! Bhai itne maze se kirtan kar raha hai jitna maza mujhe dhandhe mein aata hai! Super fun!! (He's having as much fun at kirtan as I have in doing business)."

255.title: Have done enough work, don't need poll symbol to get elected: Maha CM
255.article_body: Maharashtra CM Eknath Shinde said he has worked a lot in his constituency and doesn't need an election symbol to get elected. He asserted that his government only forged "a natural alliance of Shiv Sena once again". "We took this decision because...in...upcoming elections, Shiv Sena would have had only that many MLAs as...can be counted on fingers," he added.

256.title: Man kills wife in front of 9-year-old daughter in Pune, arrested
256.article_body: A 35-year-old man allegedly killed his 30-year-old wife with a piece of stone floor tile in front of their nine-year-old daughter in Pune's Wakad area on Monday, police said. The accused, who had fled after committing the crime, has been arrested, police added. "We have learnt that the two were having disputes over domestic issues for some time," police stated.

257.title: Sensex gains 155 points, Nifty above 17,380 in opening trade
257.article_body: The benchmark indices opened in green on Wednesday with the Sensex gaining 155.47 points at 58,291.83, while the Nifty was above 17,380.50 points with 35 points up. Bharti Airtel, Eicher Motors, JSW Steel, Cipla and Power Grid Corp were among the top gainers on Nifty. Stocks of Kotak Mahindra Bank, Coal India, Maruti Suzuki, Tata Motors and M&M slipped.

258.title: US' determination to preserve democracy in Taiwan remains iron-clad: Nancy Pelosi
258.article_body: After visiting Taiwan despite China's warnings, US House Speaker Nancy Pelosi said, "America's determination to preserve democracy here in Taiwan and in the world remains iron-clad." "Taiwan is flourishing democracy....Now, more than ever, America's solidarity with Taiwan is crucial, that's the message we bring in today," Pelosi said after meeting President of Taiwan, Tsai Ing-wen.

259.title: We felt like we had enough: Pooran after defeat in 3rd T20I vs India
259.article_body: Speaking at the post-match presentation ceremony after their seven-wicket defeat in the third T20I against India, West Indies captain Nicholas Pooran said they felt they had enough runs on the board to win the game. "Wicket was on the slower side, felt it was difficult to keep scoring on it," he added. India chased down WI's 165-run target to win.

260.title: Cong MP wears garland of vegetables to Parliament to protest against price rise
260.article_body: Congress MP Rajani Patil on Tuesday wore a garland of raw vegetables to Parliament as a sign of protest against inflation and price rise. "Housewives are distraught," Patil said. "We wore these vegetables today to express sympathy for them. Until prices fall, we women won't have a sense of relief but FM isn't ready to listen to us," she stated.

261.title: 'Kesariya' is no. 1 on the charts: Alia on 'love storiyaan' criticism
261.article_body: Actress Alia Bhatt has reacted to the criticism of the song 'Kesariya' from her upcoming film 'Brahmastra'. "The song is number one on the charts, then why should I complain," she stated. The song received criticism and trolling for the use of the lyrics 'love storiyaan'. The film also features actor Ranbir Kapoor.

262.title: Important to forget defeat, come back stronger for individual games: PV Sindhu
262.article_body: After the Indian shuttlers lost the final in the badminton mixed team event at CWG 2022, two-time Olympic medal-winning shuttler PV Sindhu said they need to forget the defeat and come back stronger in individual events. "A bit sad that [we] missed gold...[but] it's part of the game...it's time to chill...and then prepare for the individual [matches]," she stated.

263.title: Mumbai to witness good rainfall next week: IMD
263.article_body: The India Meteorological Department (IMD) has predicted good rainfall in Mumbai post weekend (from August 8), along with partly cloudy skies with possibility of light thundershowers in the city and suburbs over the next two days. Districts around Mumbai, including Thane, Raigad, Satara, Pune and Kolhapur, have been given a yellow alert for Friday and Saturday by the meteorological department.

264.title: Number of people hospitalised after gas leak in company in Andhra rises to 87
264.article_body: The number of people who have been hospitalised following the suspected gas leak at a company in the Brandix Special Economic Zone in Andhra Pradesh's Anakapalle has risen to 87. No casualties have been reported yet and all the victims are in stable condition, police said. Those who have been hospitalised complained of nausea, stomach ache, cough and suffocation.

265.title: US sanctions Putin's rumoured girlfriend, freezes her visa
265.article_body: The US has imposed sanctions on Russian President Vladimir Putin's rumoured girlfriend Alina Kabaeva and other Russian elites. The US' Treasury Department said that the government has frozen Kabaeva's visa and imposed other property restrictions. Alina is an Olympic medal-winning gymnast and also the head of a Russian national media company.

266.title: Is govt worried about Mehul Choksi, Nirav Modi?: Congress’ Adhir
266.article_body: Congress leader Adhir Ranjan Chowdhury said that the party knows BJP’s strategy to anyhow "frame and intimidate" the Opposition. "DHFL caused a loss of ₹34,615 crore. From Mehul Choksi to Nirav Modi, they pocketed thousands of crores. Is the government worried about them?" Chowdhury asked. "Have they tried to get it back?" Chowdhury added.

267.title: China summons US ambassador over Pelosi's 'egregious' trip to Taiwan
267.article_body: China summoned US ambassador Nicholas Burns to protest against US House Speaker Nancy Pelosi's "egregious" visit to Taiwan, state media reported. The US "shall pay the price for its own mistakes", Chinese Vice Foreign Minister Xie Feng said. Xie also urged Washington to "immediately address its wrongdoings, take practical measures to undo the adverse effects caused by Pelosi's visit".

268.title: 4 labourers fall to death from 17th floor while fixing crane in Gurugram
268.article_body: At least four labourers died and one was seriously injured after they fell off the 17th floor of a residential society in Gurugram's sector 77 on Tuesday evening. The accident took place when five labourers were dismantling a tower crane at Emaar Palm Heights. One of the labourers fell on the safety equipment on the 12th floor, police said.

269.title: We get together once a week, will always be a family: Aamir on his ex-wives
269.article_body: Actor Aamir Khan opened up about his equation with his ex-wives Reena Dutta and Kiran Rao on 'Koffee With Karan 7'. "I have the highest regard and respect for both of them. We will always be a family," the 'Laal Singh Chaddha' actor said. He further added, "We all get together once a week, no matter how busy we are."

270.title: Amazon leases land from L&T in Mumbai's Powai to set up data centre
270.article_body: Amazon Data Services India leased 5.5 acres of industrial land with a possible growth space of 2.39 lakh sq ft, from Larsen & Toubro, in suburban Mumbai's Powai space for setting up a data centre for ₹3.57 crore per month. The lease for the land is for 21 years and six months, with a lock-in period of 15 years.

271.title: 2 people arrested for faking accident, extorting money in Bengaluru
271.article_body: Bengaluru Police on Tuesday arrested two people for allegedly extorting money by faking to be accident victims. The accused had reportedly threatened a car owner by acting as victim after hitting the car with their bikes. They then collected ₹40,000 from the car owner, reports said. According to police, the same bikes had been used in similar offences in past.

272.title: Who are India's medal contenders at CWG 2022 for today?
272.article_body: Weightlifters Lovepreet Singh, Purnima Pandey and Gurdeep Singh will participate in their respective finals at CWG 2022 today. Saurav Ghosal will feature in men's squash bronze medal match. Swimmers Advait Page and Kushagra Rawat's 1500m men's freestyle final will also take place today. Tejaswin Shankar and Manpreet Kaur will feature in men's high jump and women's shot put finals, respectively.

273.title: Who clinched medals for India at CWG 2022 on Day 5?
273.article_body: India clinched four medals on Day 5 of CWG 2022. Lovely Choubey, Rupa Rani Tirkey, Pinki and Nayanmoni Saikia won the women's fours lawn bowls event to clinch India's first-ever CWG gold in lawn bowls. India bagged gold in table tennis men's team event and silver in badminton mixed team event. Weightlifter Vikas Thakur bagged silver in men's 96-kg category.

274.title: There is no GST on withdrawal of cash from banks: FM Sitharaman
274.article_body: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman has said there is no GST on withdrawal of cash from banks. She added that 10 transactions from ATMs are totally free, including five from the parent bank and five from other banks' ATMs. She said GST is imposed on banks as they purchase cheque books from printers and there is no tax on customer cheques.

275.title: How does the CWG 2022 medal tally read as India win 2 gold medals on Day 5?
275.article_body: India bagged two gold medals on Day 5, taking their gold medal tally at CWG 2022 to five. India have clinched a total of 13 medals so far. India are placed sixth on the medal standings. With 42 gold medals, Australia lead the standings, followed by England (31), New Zealand (13), Canada (11) and South Africa (6).

276.title: Vikas Thakur pays tribute to Sidhu Moosewala, celebrates his silver with 'thappi'
276.article_body: Weightlifter Vikas Thakur celebrated his CWG 2022 silver in men's 96-kg category by paying tribute to late singer Sidhu Moosewala. After lifting 191 kg in clean and jerk, Vikas did Moosewala's signature 'thappi'. "It was a tribute to Moosewala...I didn't eat for two days after his death...I've never met him but his songs will remain with me forever," Vikas said.

277.title: I failed in Chemistry, can't help my child with that or Physics: Alia
277.article_body: Actress Alia Bhatt said she "failed" in Chemistry and won't be able to help her future child with the subject, despite having a lot of chemistry with her husband Ranbir Kapoor on-screen. Alia added she won't be able to guide her future child with Physics also. "Biology I will still manage," she stated. Alia announced her pregnancy in June 2022.

278.title: Many times actors give money back when films don't do well: Alia Bhatt
278.article_body: Actress Alia Bhatt said the producers think that a reassessment of actors' fees needs to be done. She added that actors feel the same way too. "Many times, an actor charges a certain fee...when the film doesn't do well, they don't charge the balance fee. They even give the money back. But we don't do PR for that," she stated.

279.title: Bengaluru reports 1,274 new COVID-19 cases, active cases reach 8,296
279.article_body: Bengaluru reported 1,274 new COVID-19 cases on Tuesday, taking the number of active cases in the city to 8,296, according to data shared by Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP) chief Tushar Giri Nath. No deaths were recorded in the city on Tuesday. The test positivity rate for the last seven days now stands at 7.58%, data showed.

280.title: Video shows tanks rolling on packed beach in China amid tensions over Taiwan
280.article_body: A video showing tanks rolling on a packed beach in China amid tensions over US House Speaker Nancy Pelosi's visit to Taiwan has surfaced online. Social media users shared videos of tanks on highways and reported spotting heavy movement of armoured vehicles near the border with Taiwan, which China claims as its own territory.

281.title: CNG, PNG prices increase by ₹6 and ₹4 respectively in Mumbai; 5th hike in 2022
281.article_body: Compressed Natural Gas (CNG) and domestic Piped Natural Gas (PNG) prices have increased in Mumbai, effective from midnight of August 2. CNG will now cost ₹86/kg, after an increase of ₹6 and PNG will cost ₹52.50/Standard Cubic Metre (SCM), after an increase of ₹4. This is the fifth time in 2022 that CNG and PNG prices have increased in Mumbai.

282.title: Liquor vends open in Delhi with limited stocks, 126 give up licence
282.article_body: Liquor vends in national capital reopened on Tuesday with limited stocks as Delhi government extended their permits for a month. Meanwhile, 126 liquor shops located in areas like Greater Kailash, Rohini and Chandni Chowk gave up their licence. The new excise policy aimed to open 849 liquor shops in Delhi, but only 468 vends were reportedly operational on July 31.

283.title: Mumbai man poses as woman on Facebook, extorts money; arrested
283.article_body: A 29-year-old man was arrested by Mumbai Police for allegedly extorting money from another man by posing as a woman on Facebook. The accused, Sushant Talshilkar, allegedly claimed to be a resident of the victim's housing society and exchanged obscene pictures, an official said. Talshilkar also demanded ₹10,000 from the victim for not leaking their chats on society's Whatsapp group.

284.title: India record their highest successful T20I run chase in West Indies, take 2-1 series lead
284.article_body: India defeated West Indies by seven wickets in the third T20I to take a 2-1 series lead. India recorded their highest successful T20I run chase on West Indies soil by chasing down a 165-run target. India's previous highest successful T20I chase on West Indies soil had come on August 6, 2019, when they chased down a 147-run target.

285.title: 13-year-old boy runs away from home in anger near Mumbai, rescued
285.article_body: Maharashtra's Panvel Taluka Police reunited a 13-year-old boy with his family after he ran away from his home in Revdanda after getting angry over some issues. He had come to Panvel, near Mumbai, instead of going to school on Monday. Police rescued the boy after finding him standing near a tea stall in school uniform at Panvel ST bus station.

286.title: India win silver in badminton mixed team event, take their medal tally at CWG 2022 to 13
286.article_body: Defending champions India bagged a silver medal in the badminton mixed team event at Commonwealth Games (CWG) 2022. India lost the final 1-3 against Malaysia. In the final, India lost the men's doubles, men's singles and women's doubles matches. India's only victory in the final came through PV Sindhu's women's singles encounter.

287.title: Can't compromise quality of education with 100% reservation: SC
287.article_body: Striking down the decision of the Jharkhand government reserving 100% teaching posts for locals in government-run tribal district schools, the Supreme Court said quality of education cannot be compromised due to reservation. Tribal teachers filed appeals after they were suddenly out of jobs. The non-tribal teachers called the state government's decision a violation of their fundamental rights.

288.title: Devotees should visit Amarnath shrine before Aug 5: J&K LG
288.article_body: Jammu and Kashmir Lieutenant Governor, Manoj Sinha, told Amarnath devotees to visit the shrine before August 5 due to predictions that weather would turn more inclement later. The yatra is scheduled to end on August 11. In July, a cloudburst struck the holy cave of Amarnath, which resulted in overflowing of the 'Nallah', adjoining the cave.

289.title: Man supplying arms to Khalistanis arrested in Madhya Pradesh
289.article_body: The Madhya Pradesh Police have arrested a man for allegedly supplying arms to Khalistanis. The accused, identified as 22-year-old Asan Singh, was arrested in Burhanpur and several country-made pistols were recovered from him. Police said that they had received information that Asan Singh was involved with Khalistanis and had since launched an operation to arrest him.

290.title: New Startup and Innovation Policy soon: MK Stalin
290.article_body: The Tamil Nadu government will unveil a new Startup and Innovation policy, Chief Minister MK Stalin said. "My dream is Tamil Nadu should become the numero uno investment destination in South Asia. Development has been planned to ensure adequate representation of regions and districts in the state," Stalin said. He said he was working towards achieving the $1 trillion economy.

291.title: Centre invites MPs of all parties for Tiranga bike rally on Aug 3
291.article_body: A Tiranga bike rally will be organised from the Red Fort to the Parliament on August 3. Union Minister of Parliamentary Affairs Pralhad Joshi urged members of all political parties to attend it. After the BJP Parliamentary Party Meeting, he said that the event was being organised by the Culture Ministry and not the BJP.

292.title: Interim govt must focus on inflation and security: Bulgaria Prez
292.article_body: Bulgarian President Rumen Radev on Tuesday urged the country's interim government to ensure spiralling inflation is brought under control and that Sofia stays away from the Russia-Ukraine war. Bulgaria will head to the polls in October after PM Kiril Petkov's government collapsed in June. Apart from inflation and regional conflicts, Bulgaria also faces the uncertainty of natural gas supplies.

293.title: India's Kuruvilla beats Pak's Zafar to enter CWG women's singles plate final
293.article_body: Indian squash player Sunayna Kuruvilla beat Pakistan's Faiza Zafar 3-0 to reach the women's singles plate final at the Commonwealth Games 2022 in Birmingham on Tuesday. Kuruvilla won the semi-final with a scoreline of 11-2, 11-4, 11-5. The 23-year-old will face Mary Fung-A-Fat, who beat Pakistan's Amna Fayyaz 3-2, on Wednesday. Earlier, Saurav Ghosal lost in men's singles semi-final.

294.title: Two arrested in Assam for alleged links with terror group in B'desh
294.article_body: Two individuals with alleged links to an Al-Qaeda network in Bangladesh have been arrested in Assam's Barpeta district, police said on Tuesday. According to police, one of the suspects was arrested on Sunday and the other one on Tuesday. Earlier on Monday, Assam Police had informed that 11 persons were arrested for suspected links with Bangladesh-based Ansarullah Bangla Team(ABT).

295.title: UN chief to visit Japan on 77th anniversary of atomic bombing
295.article_body: UN Secretary-General Antonio Guterres will attend the 77th anniversary of the world's first atomic bombing at the annual ceremony at Japan's Hiroshima Peace Memorial. "The ceremony aims to console the souls of those lost to...bombing...pray for...lasting world peace," UN spokesman Stephane Dujarric said. The US dropped the atomic bomb on Hiroshima on August 6, 1945, killing 1,40,000 people.

296.title: US Prez Biden picks senior officials to lead response to monkeypox
296.article_body: US President Joe Biden appointed two senior federal officials to coordinate the government's response to monkeypox, said the White House on Tuesday. The officials are from the Federal Emergency Management Agency and the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention. Unlike the Biden administration, the states of New York, California and Illinois have declared a state of emergency over the disease.

297.title: Congress living in slavery for Gandhis: Anurag Thakur on protests
297.article_body: Claiming that the Congress party is "still living in slavery" for the Gandhi family, Union Minister Anurag Thakur slammed the party leaders for questioning the investigation against Sonia and Rahul Gandhi in the National Herald case. "Does the law not apply to the Congress leaders?" he asked. Following ED summons to Sonia Gandhi, Congress leaders protested across the country.

298.title: Water to get costlier in Gurugram as GMDA announces 5% hike
298.article_body: Water supplied by the Gurugram Metropolitan Development Authority will now be costlier, with the authority announcing a 5% hike in the bulk water supply. GMDA officials on Tuesday stated that charges for bulk water supply, for both residential and industrial connections, will now be ₹10.50 per kilolitre as against the earlier tariff of ₹10 per kilolitre.

299.title: German rail operator staff who save energy to get monetary benefits
299.article_body: German rail operator Deutsche Bahn on Tuesday said it is offering its staff monetary benefits to save energy at the workplace. This move comes in as Russian energy giant Gazprom significantly reduced its supplies to Germany ahead of winter. Deutsche Bahn said each employee will be given a bonus of at least Euro 100 ($102) to start the conservation efforts.

300.title: They demonstrated great dexterity: PM after Indian women's lawn bowls team win gold
300.article_body: After India bagged gold in women's fours lawn bowls event at CWG, PM Narendra Modi tweeted, "Historic win in Birmingham...India is proud of Lovely Choubey, Pinki Singh, Nayanmoni Saikia and Rupa Rani Tirkey for bringing home the prestigious gold in lawn bowls." He added, "The team has demonstrated great dexterity and their success will motivate many Indians towards lawn bowls."

301.title: Over 20 Chinese military planes enter Taiwan's airspace after Pelosi's visit
301.article_body: More than 20 Chinese military planes entered Taiwan's airspace shortly after US House Speaker Nancy Pelosi landed in Taipei on Tuesday, Taiwan said. Pelosi landed in Taiwan on Tuesday evening, defying a string of warnings and threats from China. China called Pelosi's Taiwan visit "extremely dangerous" and said it will "launch a series of targeted military operations to counter this".

302.title: Actors don't want to work with me, most want younger actresses: Neena
302.article_body: Neena Gupta has said finding male actors opposite her in projects is the "most difficult thing" because no one wants to work with her. "Most of them want...younger actresses...although I might look younger than them," the 63-year-old actress added. Neena further said she wants to thank Ram Kapoor for taking up the role opposite her despite being younger than her.

303.title: Wanted to do Nach Baliye but was told 'you are not a big actor': Kiku
303.article_body: Actor-comedian Kiku Sharda, recalling his early days in the television industry, said he wanted to do reality shows like 'Nach Baliye' and 'Jhalak Dikhhla Jaa'. "But nobody called me...I'd be told, 'You're a good actor but not a big actor...You're not...celebrity'," he added. Kiku said he got a call from Nach Baliye's team after he started doing Kapil Sharma's show.

304.title: Cong workers chant 'ED, haye haye' outside Herald House after raids
304.article_body: Congress workers staged a protest outside the Herald House on Tuesday after the Enforcement Directorate (ED) conducted raids at 12 locations in Delhi in connection with the National Herald money laundering case. A video showed protesters chanting, "ED, haye haye (shame shame)." Congress leaders Sonia Gandhi and Rahul Gandhi have been questioned by the ED in connection with the case.

305.title: CCTVs were turned off during IELTS exam: Police on alleged racket in Gujarat
305.article_body: An investigation into an alleged IELTS racket in Gujarat, to get ineligible students admitted to foreign universities, revealed a lack of transparency by the exam agency. Police said that hall CCTVs were turned off during the exam in September 2021. The matter came to light after Indian youths with top IELTS scores failed to speak English in a US court.

306.title: Indian adaptation of Israeli show 'The Hood' in the works
306.article_body: An Indian adaptation of Israeli teen drama series 'The Hood' is in works. The show, titled 'Shchuna' in Israel, follows the children of a small slum located in the heart of a wealthy settlement and explores the differences between the poor and the rich. Israeli-based media company Ananey Studios has signed a deal with Abundantia Entertainment to develop the adaptation.

307.title: Lebanese prosecutor clears ship accused of carrying Ukrainian grain
307.article_body: The Syrian ship that Kyiv had claimed was carrying Ukrainian grain stolen by Russia was cleared to leave Tripoli port by Lebanon's prosecutor general, officials cited by AP said on Tuesday. This reportedly comes after investigation showed that the ship was not carrying stolen goods. However, the ship cannot leave the country till the expiration of a Lebanese court order.

308.title: CM Shinde busy in felicitations instead of providing aid to farmers: Pawar
308.article_body: NCP leader Ajit Pawar alleged that Maharashtra CM Eknath Shinde is "busy accepting felicitations" over providing aid to farmers. "Soyabean and cotton farmers have suffered huge losses due to floods in Vidarbha and Marathwada region," Pawar said. He added, "No word has been sent to the Centre and, as a result, no team from there has visited yet for inspection."

309.title: 2 suspected patients test negative for monkeypox in Rajasthan
309.article_body: The test results of two suspected cases of monkeypox in Rajasthan came back negative, Dr Ajit Singh, Superintendent of Rajasthan University of Health Sciences said on Tuesday. A 20-year-old youth from Kishangarh and a man from Bharatpur were referred to the institute after showing symptoms similar to those of monkeypox.

310.title: Zimbabwe's Ryan Burl smashes 34 runs in an over against Bangladesh in T20I, hits 5 sixes
310.article_body: Zimbabwe's Ryan Burl today smashed 34 runs in an over in the third T20I against Bangladesh. The 28-year-old smashed five sixes and one four in the over bowled by Nasum Ahmed. Only Yuvraj Singh and Kieron Pollard (36 each) have scored more runs in an over than Burl in T20I cricket. Zimbabwe defeated Bangladesh by 10 runs in the match.

311.title: ED probing crypto exchange WazirX for money laundering of ₹2,790 cr: Govt
311.article_body: Minister of State for Finance Pankaj Chaudhary has said the Enforcement Directorate (ED) is probing WazirX for allegedly laundering ₹2,790 crore. He added that investigation done so far has revealed that WazirX was using walled infrastructure of Cayman Islands-based Binance. It has also been found that all transactions between the two exchanges weren't even being recorded on blockchains, he said.

312.title: After laying off 624 employees in May, Vedantu lays off another 100: Reports
312.article_body: Bengaluru-based edtech startup Vedantu has laid off another 100 employees in a restructuring exercise, reports said. According to reports, permanent employees from sales and training teams were laid off over the last month. In May, the company had laid off 624 employees, including permanent employees and contractual educators, accounting for over 10% of its workforce.

313.title: Delhi reports 1,506 new COVID-19 cases, positivity rate at 10.63%
313.article_body: Delhi reported 1,506 fresh cases of COVID-19 on Tuesday, while the positivity rate in the national capital decreased to 10.63%. Delhi also reported three deaths in the last 24 hours. The positivity rate in the city was at 11.41% on Monday, the highest in the last six months. Delhi reported 822 COVID-19 cases on Monday.

314.title: IFS officer Shweta Singh appointed as Director in PMO
314.article_body: Indian Foreign Service (IFS) officer Shweta Singh was appointed as a Director in Prime Minister's Office (PMO), a Personnel Ministry order said on Tuesday. The Appointments Committee of the Cabinet (ACC) approved Singh's appointment for a period of three years. The ACC has cancelled the appointment of Aniket Govind Mandavgane as the Deputy Secretary in the PMO.

315.title: 2 more held in K'taka BJP youth leader Praveen Nettaru's murder case
315.article_body: Karnataka Police on Tuesday arrested two more persons, 32-year-old Saddam and 42-year-old Harris, in connection with the BJP Yuva Morcha worker Praveen Nettaru's murder case. Two others, Zakir and Shafiq, were arrested in connection with the case on 28 July. Praveen Nettaru was hacked to death by two bike-borne miscreants on July 26 in Bellare in Dakshina Kannada district.

316.title: Sri Lanka looks for friendly settlement of Chinese ship issue: PM
316.article_body: Sri Lanka is looking forward to settling the issue of a Chinese research vessel's visit to the country with an "approach of friendship", Sri Lankan PM Dinesh Gunawardena said on Tuesday. "Both countries are our close friends," he added. The vessel is "coming to refuel and not for any other purpose", a Sri Lankan Cabinet spokesman said

317.title: US Ambassador to Japan warns of China's economic coercion
317.article_body: US Ambassador to Japan Rahm Emanuel on Tuesday said his country is working with like-minded nations like Japan to counter Chinese efforts of using economic power to make political changes around the world. Emanuel laid out several examples of China's coercion, including with Japan, South Korea and Australia. He said he is pushing what he calls "commercial diplomacy".

318.title: Salman Khan spotted in ₹1.5 crore bulletproof car, pic surfaces
318.article_body: Actor Salman Khan, who has reportedly upgraded to a Toyota Land Cruiser with bulletproof glass, was spotted arriving in the car at the Mumbai airport on Monday evening. As per various reports, the new vehicle costs around ₹1.5 crore. The actor has upgraded to the new armoured car amid threats to his life, reports said.

319.title: India raises concerns over Chinese 'spy' ship's visit to Lanka next week: Reports
319.article_body: India has raised concerns over the upcoming visit of a Chinese surveillance ship to Sri Lanka next week, reports said on Tuesday. The matter of Yuan Wang 5's docking was raised by India at the highest level in Colombo, reports said, following which Sri Lanka said it will only stop to refuel. India earlier said it was monitoring the visit.

320.title: Banks in India reported 248 data breaches in last 4 years: Govt
320.article_body: Banks in India reported 248 successful data breaches by hackers and miscreants between June 2018 and March 2022, Minister of State for Finance Bhagwat Karad said. Most of these data breaches pertain to card detail leakage and theft of business and non-business information, Karad said. Public sector banks reported 41 data breaches while private sector banks reported 205 data attacks.

321.title: If we were traitors, would people support us?: Maha CM Shinde
321.article_body: Responding to Shiv Sena chief Uddhav Thackeray's "traitor" remark, Maharashtra CM Eknath Shinde on Tuesday said if he and his supporters had been traitors, they would not have received support from the state's people. NCP and Congress, who were supposed to be out of power after 2019, received a "sanjivani butee" because of their alliance with the Sena, he said.

322.title: Centre aims to transform the country, make it corruption-free: Gadkari
322.article_body: Union Road Transport Minister Nitin Gadkari on Tuesday said the aim of the central government is to transform the country and make it corruption-free. Addressing an 'Azadi ka Amrit Mahotsav' event organised by the Republican Party of India (RPI) in Delhi, he said the Centre will eliminate poverty and aims to bring socio-economic parity between people.

323.title: MP man gets life in jail for burning wife for cutting garlic without permission
323.article_body: A man in Madhya Pradesh has been sentenced to life imprisonment for burning his wife to death. In 2018, the accused, Prakash Bheela, had beaten up his wife and burnt her by pouring kerosene on her after she cut garlic without informing him. The court issued an order for an arrest warrant against Bheela, who is currently out on bail.

324.title: 9 killed, 76 hurt as oil tanker explodes in Libya
324.article_body: Around nine people were killed and 76 others injured when a fuel tanker caught fire and exploded in central Libya, officials said. It overturned in Bent Bayya and scores of people started collecting leaked gasoline when the truck exploded. The injured were taken to nearby medical centres and 16 critical persons were sent to the capital of Tripoli and Benghazi.

325.title: Indian squash player Ghosal crashes out in men's singles semis at CWG 2022
325.article_body: Indian squash player Saurav Ghosal crashed out in the men's singles semi-final at the Commonwealth Games (CWG) 2022 in Birmingham. Paul Coll of New Zealand beat Ghosal 3-0 on Tuesday. The 35-year-old lost with a scoreline of 9-11, 4-11, 1-11. Ghosal will now play in the bronze medal match on Wednesday.

326.title: 9 TV channels taken off air between 2017-2022 for code violation: Thakur
326.article_body: Information and Broadcasting Minister Anurag Thakur informed that nine TV channels were taken off air for a specified period between 2017-2022 for code violations. Replying to a Lok Sabha question, Thakur also informed that the ministry has issued directions to block 94 YouTube-based news channels during 2021-22. He added, "CBFC has...refused certification to 11 songs [during 2017-2022]."

327.title: Tax on devotion: Punjab CM on 12% GST on inns near Golden Temple
327.article_body: Punjab CM condemned the Centre's decision to impose a 12% GST on inns near Golden Temple. He said the tax has been imposed on pilgrims' devotion. Shiromani Gurdwara Parbandhak Committee also criticised the Centre's decision, arguing that inns for pilgrims aren't commercial properties. In June, GST Council decided to impose a 12% GST on hotel rooms priced up to ₹1,000/day.

328.title: Nearly 25% of undertrial prisoners in India were in UP as of 2020: Govt
328.article_body: The Union Home Ministry on Tuesday said that as of 2020, nearly 25% of the country's 3,71,848 undertrial prisoners were in Uttar Pradesh. With 80,557 undertrial prisoners, Uttar Pradesh accounted for the highest number of undertrial prisoners, followed by Bihar with 44,187 undertrial prisoners. Arunachal Pradesh had the lowest number of undertrial prisoners at 127.

329.title: 50 hospitalised after suspected gas leak at company in Andhra
329.article_body: Over 50 women working at a company in the Brandix Special Economic Zone in Andhra Pradesh's Anakapalle district fell sick following suspected gas leakage. The employees, who complained of nausea, stomach ache, cough and suffocation, were admitted to the government hospital at Anakapalle and a few other hospitals. Police have launched an investigation into the matter.

330.title: Brad Pitt's pictures in skirt on the red carpet go viral
330.article_body: Brad Pitt recently arrived at the Berlin premiere of his upcoming film 'Bullet Train' in a skirt. He wore a knee-length skirt and boots, paired with a loose-fit linen shirt and jacket. Speaking with Variety and addressing the choice of his outfit, the actor said, "I don't know! We're all going to die, so let's mess it up."

331.title: Stellar show: Anurag Thakur on Indian men's table tennis team's CWG 2022 gold
331.article_body: Sports Minister Anurag Thakur took to Twitter following defending champions India's gold medal win in men's table tennis team event at Commonwealth Games 2022 on Tuesday and wrote, "A stellar show by the Indian men's table tennis team." He added, "Exhilarated by the way, our paddlers led by Sharath Kamal, Sathiyan Gnanasekaran and Harmeet Desai outclassed the formidable Singapore 3-1."

332.title: Followers of Iraqi cleric asked to vacate Parliament amid protest
332.article_body: Followers of Iraqi cleric Muqtada al-Sadr who stormed the Parliament and occupied it as part of a protest have been asked to vacate the building. The protesters were told to move the protest outside the premises of the Parliament. The protest had started last week against the formation of a new government by Sadr's political rivals.

333.title: Reports of Chinese fighter jets crossing Taiwan Strait false: Taiwan
333.article_body: Taiwan's Defence Ministry said on Tuesday that Chinese state media reports on China's Su-35 fighter jets crossing the Taiwan Strait, which separates the island from China, are false. The ministry added that it would appropriately dispatch forces in reaction to "enemy threats". This comes amid US House Speaker Nancy Pelosi's visit to Taiwan despite Beijing's warnings of consequences over it.

334.title: Maldives has special place in India's 'Neighbourhood First' policy: PM
334.article_body: PM Narendra Modi said on Tuesday that the Maldives occupies a special place in India's 'Neighbourhood First' policy. His remarks come amid Maldivian President Ibrahim Mohamed Solih's visit to India, which is Solih's third visit since assuming office in November 2018. Notably, India will extend an additional credit line of $100 million to the island nation, PM Modi confirmed today.

335.title: Juice shop worker arrested in IIT Madras sexual assault case
335.article_body: The Chennai city police on Tuesday arrested a 24-year-old man in connection with the alleged sexual assault case, which took place inside the campus of IIT Madras in Tamil Nadu last week. A female student was sexually assaulted on July 24 at midnight, when she was returning to her hostel on a cycle.

336.title: Will urge Centre for early wind up of India-Myanmar border fencing: Manipur CM
336.article_body: Manipur CM N Biren Singh said that the state will urge the Centre for early completion of India-Myanmar border fencing work after resolving the border dispute. Responding to queries raised by Congress MLA K Ranjit Singh in the Assembly, CM Biren said that the border fencing of 5.6 km from border pillar number 79 to 81 has been presently completed.

337.title: Not in favour of bars being allowed to open till 3 am: Delhi Police
337.article_body: The Delhi Police has told the High Court that it was not in favour of bars and restaurants serving liquor till 3 am. The Delhi Police and Excise Department were asked to constitute a consultative group to examine the issue. The police in its report said that women's safety was a big concern.

338.title: 2,171 people infected with monkeypox in France: Health Minister
338.article_body: France's Health Minister François Braun on Tuesday told the Parliament that a total of 2,171 people have been infected with monkeypox in the country. France was one of the first countries to start offering free vaccination against the disease, he added. Braun further said that 42,000 doses have been delivered so far.

339.title: 2 hospitals in K'taka designated for monkeypox treatment: Minister
339.article_body: Karnataka Health Minister K Sudhakar said that two hospitals in the state have been designated for the treatment of monkeypox. "We're taking all precautionary measures to make sure that monkeypox cases do not come to Karnataka," K Sudhakar said. "We've issued guidelines regarding international travellers at airports and ports," the Health Minister added.

340.title: 11 thrash Kanwariyas over playing music on speakers in UP, arrested
340.article_body: Around 11 people have been arrested for allegedly thrashing some Kanwariyas over playing music on speakers in UP's Wazirganj area, police said on Tuesday. The incident took place in Dungarpur village on Monday evening when the Kanwariyas were returning from Bareilly, police added. The accused have been arrested under relevant sections of the IPC, said SP OP Singh.

341.title: ED has become 'weapon of mass destruction' after SC judgement: Cong MP
341.article_body: Criticising the Enforcement Directorate (ED) over raids at National Herald house, Congress MP Karti Chidambaram said ED was weaponised earlier, but after the Supreme Court judgement, it has become a "weapon of mass destruction". "It's ridiculous that they (ED) raid the premises of a publication whose transactions are anyway captured in the books of accounts," he said.

342.title: Shinde-led Maha govt sets record by issuing 749 resolutions in a month
342.article_body: The newly formed Maharashtra government led by CM Eknath Shinde and Deputy CM Devendra Fadnavis has set a new record by issuing 749 government resolutions in a month. These government decisions are purely administrative in nature, related to filling up of deputation posts, provisional seniority list, etc. On an average, 25 government resolutions were issued daily.

343.title: India reported 330 deaths while cleaning septic tanks in 5 yrs: Govt
343.article_body: The central government on Tuesday said 330 people died due to the cleaning of sewer and septic tanks from 2017-2021. However, Union Minister of State for Social Justice and Empowerment Ramdas Athawale added that there have been no deaths due to manual scavenging in the country. Uttar Pradesh reported the highest number of deaths at 47 from 2017 to 2021.

344.title: MMA fighter Blake Perry's face disfigured after opponent breaks his nose, pic surfaces
344.article_body: US' 27-year-old MMA fighter Blake Perry's face was disfigured after having his nose shattered during his defeat to Marcel McCain in A1 Combat 4 MMA tournament. The incident happened in first round when McCain hit Perry's face with a knee. Blake wanted to continue the fight but wasn't allowed. "I'm healing up quick," Blake wrote on Instagram sharing videos.

345.title: Pics of rare 'ring galaxy' taken by world's most powerful telescope released
345.article_body: The pictures of a rare 'ring galaxy' called Cartwheel Galaxy taken by the world's most powerful telescope, the James Webb Space Telescope, have been released by NASA. NASA tweeted, "Believe it or not...this galaxy was probably your average spiral galaxy before it collided with a smaller galaxy over 400 million years ago. Now, it's made up of 2 rings."

346.title: Giant 650-foot-deep sinkhole opens up in Chile, picture emerges
346.article_body: Chilean authorities on Monday said they are investigating a giant 'mysterious' sinkhole which opened up near the capital city Santiago. The sinkhole is about 25 meters (82 feet) in diameter and is approximately 200 metres (656 feet) deep, an official said. "We haven't detected any material down there, but we've seen the presence of a lot of water," he added.

347.title: India's trade deficit hits record high of $31 billion in July
347.article_body: India's merchandise trade deficit jumped to a new record high of $31.02 billion in July, Commerce Secretary BVR Subrahmanyam said on Tuesday. The previous record high was set in June 2022, when trade deficit was $26.18 billion. As per provisional data released by the Commerce Ministry, merchandise imports stood at $66.26 billion while exports stood at $35.24 billion in July.

348.title: 115 arrested for illegal mining in Rajasthan
348.article_body: In a drive against illegal mining, Rajasthan Police arrested 115 people and impounded 278 vehicles from July 22 to 31, an official said on Tuesday.
