Additional Director General of Police Hawa Singh Ghumaria said 12,616 tonnes of illegally mined stone, gravel and sand were seized. In total, 191 cases have been registered across the state.

349.title: Will launch military action to counter this: China as Pelosi lands in Taiwan
349.article_body: China on Tuesday called US House Speaker Nancy Pelosi's Taiwan visit "extremely dangerous" and said it will "launch a series of targeted military operations to counter this". Chinese military spokesperson said that the forces have been put on "high alert". This came after Pelosi landed in Taipei and expressed "solidarity" with Taiwan, despite repeated warnings from China.

350.title: 38-year-old drunk man trying to swim across Chambal river drowns
350.article_body: A 38-year-old man drowned on Monday while trying to cross the Chambal river. He was not able to swim due to his drunken state, a report said. The man has been identified as Chagganlal Prajapat, a resident of Hatnara village, Madhya Pradesh. Prajapat was reportedly accompanying Alot's newly-elected sarpanch who had visited Goddess Joganiya temple for the purpose of blessings.

351.title: Al-Zawahiri's death shows we can root out terror without war: Obama
351.article_body: Reacting to Al-Qaeda leader Ayman al-Zawahiri's death by US drone strike in Afghanistan, ex-US President Barack Obama said that the incident highlighted that it's possible to root out terrorism without being at war. "I hope it provides a small measure of peace to...9/11 families," he added. Zawahiri became Al-Qaeda's leader after Osama bin Laden was killed in 2011.

352.title: Uber likely to sell its 7.8% stake in Zomato tomorrow: Report
352.article_body: Uber is likely to sell a 7.8% stake in food delivery firm Zomato through a $373 million block deal on Wednesday, Reuters reported. The offer size of 612 million shares is based on the lower end of a ₹48-54 price range set for the deal. Thus, the deal would be concluded at a 2.8%-13.6% discount to the share's latest close.

353.title: Indian women's hockey team lose to England 1-3 in group match at CWG 2022
353.article_body: Indian women's hockey team lost to England 1-3 in their third Pool A match at the Commonwealth Games 2022 in Birmingham on Tuesday. Vandana Katariya scored India's only goal in the fourth quarter. India are currently placed third in the group, with six points from three matches. India will face Canada in their fourth match on Wednesday.

354.title: People should focus on bigger issues: Payal on Ranveer's nude pics controversy
354.article_body: Actress Payal Rohatgi, while reacting to the controversy surrounding Ranveer Singh's nude photoshoot, said that people have made a big issue of his photoshoot which was unnecessary. She added that people should focus on bigger issues like rapes and murders. "It's really sad that they are talking about the photos and neglecting the main issues," Payal further said.

355.title: Somalia appoints former deputy leader of al-Shabaab as govt minister
355.article_body: Somalia's Prime Minister Hamza Abdi Barre on Tuesday named Mukhtar Robow, former deputy leader of al-Qaeda-linked al-Shabaab terrorist group, as the Minister for Religious Affairs. Robow had split from the group in 2013 and publicly denounced the group when he came to the government side in 2017. Al-Shabaab fighters have killed tens of thousands of people in Somalia.

356.title: Learned Hindi just to understand Amitabh Bachchan's dialogues: Sudeep
356.article_body: Actor Kiccha Sudeep has said that he was a huge fan of Amitabh Bachchan in his youth, adding that he learned Hindi just to understand his dialogues and Kishore Kumar's songs. "It wouldn't be wrong to say that people in the South have learned Hindi largely because of Kishore Kumar's songs and Amit ji's (Amitabh Bachchan) films," he added.

357.title: Congratulations for doing the unprecedented: Prez Murmu on lawn bowls CWG gold
357.article_body: President Droupadi Murmu congratulated Indian women's fours team of Lovely Choubey, Rupa Rani Tirkey, Pinki and Nayanmoni Saikia following their gold medal win in lawn bowls at CWG 2022. "Your resolve in the see-saw battle for victory in the finals made the country proud and inspired every Indian," she tweeted. It is India's first-ever gold in lawn bowls at CWG.

358.title: India announce their playing XI for 3rd T20I against West Indies
358.article_body: India captain Rohit Sharma won the toss and elected to bowl first against West Indies in the third T20I. India have made one change to their playing XI, with Deepak Hooda replacing Ravindra Jadeja. Rohit said at the toss that Jadeja is being rested for the match. Both the teams have won one match each in the five-match series.

359.title: BSF troops fire at flying object along International Border in J&K
359.article_body: BSF troops on Monday opened fire at a flying object with a blinking light along the International Border (IB) in J&K's Kanachak sector, an official informed. The unidentified object was spotted while trying to intrude into the Indian territory from across the border, he said. The blinking light was not observed after the object was fired upon, he added.

360.title: US solidarity with Taiwan more important than ever today: Pelosi on reaching Taipei
360.article_body: After reaching Taiwan's Taipei amid heightened tensions with China, US House of Representatives Speaker Nancy Pelosi said the visit "honours America's unwavering commitment to supporting Taiwan's vibrant democracy". She said, "America's solidarity with the 23 million people of Taiwan is more important today than ever." World is facing a "choice between autocracy and democracy", she added.

361.title: AAP announces 1st list of 10 candidates for Gujarat Assembly polls
361.article_body: Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) on Tuesday released its first list of 10 candidates for the upcoming Gujarat Assembly elections. The party said the candidates include members of tribal, backward and scheduled caste communities. Gujarat AAP Vice Presidents Bhemabhai Chaudhary, Jagmal Vala, Arjun Rathva and Sagar Rabari have been nominated from Deodar, Somnath, Chhotaudepur and Becharaji seats respectively.

362.title: Venus loses in 1st round at Citi Open in her 1st singles match after a year
362.article_body: Former world number one tennis player, Venus Williams, made a first-round exit at the WTA 250 Citi Open in Washington, DC. Notably, this was Williams' first singles match since August 2021. "Just a little rusty... I wish I could have pulled this match through for the crowd... But [it] doesn't always work out," the 42-year-old player said.

363.title: Rename nilgai as 'Jangli Ghoda': LS member urges Govt
363.article_body: A Samajwadi Party member on Tuesday urged the government in Lok Sabha to rename nilgai as 'Jangli Ghoda' (wild horse). Hindu sentiment is attached to monkeys, who are destroying sugarcane crops in parts of western UP, said ST Hasan. There should be an order to capture wild pigs and nilgai for saving crops, he added.

364.title: 22-year-old man booked for alleged rape of classmate in Jaipur
364.article_body: A 22-year-old man in Jaipur has been booked under IPC Section 376 after a complaint accusing him of rape was lodged by his classmate, police informed. The 20-year-old complainant was allegedly raped by the accused who gave her an intoxicating drink in the city's Jagatpura area, police added. The incident took place on Monday evening, police said citing the complaint.

365.title: Vikas Thakur lifts 346 kg to bag silver, India's 8th weightlifting medal at CWG 2022
365.article_body: Indian weightlifter Vikas Thakur bagged a silver medal in the men's 96-kg final at CWG 2022 after lifting a total of 346 kg. The 28-year-old lifted 155 kg in snatch and 191 kg in clean and jerk. India have now won as many as eight medals in weightlifting at CWG 2022, including three gold, three silver and two bronze medals.

366.title: US is directly involved in the conflict in Ukraine: Russia
366.article_body: The US is directly involved in the conflict in Ukraine because American spies have been approving and coordinating Ukrainian missile strikes on Russian forces, Russia said on Tuesday. The US has provided military aid to Ukraine. Russia's invasion of Ukraine has triggered the most serious crisis in relations between Russia and the West since the 1962 Cuban Missile Crisis.

367.title: Chinese fighter jets cross Taiwan Strait amid Nancy Pelosi's visit: Reports
367.article_body: Chinese fighter jets have crossed the Taiwan Strait, local media reported on Tuesday, amid tensions over US House Speaker Nancy Pelosi's visit to Taiwan. "China's Su-35 fighter jets are crossing the Taiwan Straits," reported state media. China had warned that US will "bear the responsibility and pay the price" if Pelosi visits Taiwan.

368.title: Russian Supreme Court labels Ukraine's Azov Regiment 'terror' group
368.article_body: Amid ongoing Russia-Ukraine war, Russian Supreme Court on Tuesday designated Ukraine's Azov Regiment as a terrorist group. This paves the way for captured soldiers to be tried under anti-terror laws and be jailed for up to 20 years. The Azov Regiment, which began as a paramilitary unit to combat pro-Russian rebels in 2014, was later integrated into Ukrainian national guard.

369.title: Student dies, 36 ill post drinking contaminated water in Chhattisgarh
369.article_body: A 19-year-old student died, while 36 others fell ill in the past three days, after allegedly consuming contaminated water at a nursing college in Chhattisgarh's Durg district, officials said on Tuesday. "The water purifier and coolers were not functioning properly and the students were drinking water from them," a senior official said.

370.title: UP govt dismisses 841 lawyers appointed in Allahabad High Court
370.article_body: The CM Yogi Adityanath government in Uttar Pradesh has issued termination notices for 841 government lawyers appointed in the Allahabad High Court with immediate effect. The order was issued by Nikunj Mittal, Special Secretary, Law and Justice Department. Additional Advocate General Vinod Kant was also dismissed and the government letter provided no reason for the termination.

371.title: 75-year-old priest found dead on temple premises in Rajasthan
371.article_body: A 75-year-old priest was found dead on the premises of a temple in Rajasthan's Dholpur district, police said on Tuesday. Harinath Giri was found hanging from a tree, said Superintendent of Police, Dholpur, Dharmendra Singh. Giri, who stayed on the temple premises in Chandpur village, belonged to Uttar Pradesh, he said.

372.title: Census 2021, related activities postponed due to COVID-19: Centre
372.article_body: Union Minister Nityanand Rai on Tuesday said Census 2021 and related field activities have been postponed indefinitely due to the outbreak of COVID-19 in March 2020. The minister added that there were no plans to add the census to the concurrent list, enabling states to conduct it. The concurrent list comprises subjects of the Union and the states' interests.

373.title: India win men's TT team gold medal for 2nd straight time at CWG
373.article_body: India defeated Singapore 3-1 to clinch gold in the men's table tennis team event at CWG 2022. This is India's second consecutive gold medal in men's table tennis team event at CWG. With this, India joined England to bag second-most table tennis gold medals (seven) at CWG. India have now won 12 medals at CWG 2022, including five gold medals.

374.title: A historic gold: Anurag Thakur on India's 1st-ever gold in lawn bowls at CWG
374.article_body: Following India's first-ever gold medal in lawn bowls at Commonwealth Games on Tuesday, Sports Minister Anurag Thakur tweeted, "A historic gold for India." He added, "Absolutely ecstatic that our women's fours team - Lovely Choubey, Pinki, Nayanmoni Saikia and Rupa Rani Tirkey has fetched the nation its first ever lawn bowls medal defeating South Africa 17-10 in the final!"

375.title: PM announces ex-gratia of ₹2 lakh for pilgrims electrocuted in WB accident
375.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Tuesday announced ex-gratia of ₹2 lakh each for the families of 10 pilgrims who died after a pickup van got electrocuted in West Bengal's Cooch Behar. He announced ₹50,000 compensation for those injured. The accident may have taken place due to a fault in the wiring of the generator of the DJ system in the van.

376.title: Kartik is the biggest star that we've today in the industry: Masaba
376.article_body: Actress-fashion designer Masaba Gupta has said that actor Kartik Aaryan is the "biggest star that we have today in the industry". Kartik recently made a cameo appearance in her web show 'Masaba Masaba season 2'. "Kartik was so nice and very spontaneous. He was great; it was great energy to have on set," Masaba further said.

377.title: UP govt sanctions ₹797 cr for roadworks near Ram temple in Ayodhya
377.article_body: During a state Cabinet meeting, the Uttar Pradesh government sanctioned ₹797.69 crore for broadening and renovating the roads leading to the Ram temple in Ayodhya. UP Tourism Minister Jaiveer Singh said the 12.940 km road from Saadatganj to Nayaghat on lines of Kashi Vishwanath Corridor, and the road from Faizabad to the Hanuman Garhi and Ram temples will be broadened.

378.title: Chennai's 2nd airport to cost ₹20,000 cr, handle 10 cr people: TN CM
378.article_body: Tamil Nadu CM MK Stalin said on Tuesday that Chennai's second airport at Parandur will cost ₹20,000 crore and have the capacity to handle around 10 crore passengers annually. He added that the airport will be equipped with requisite facilities including two runways, terminal buildings and taxiways. He cited need for a new airport due to surge in passenger traffic.

379.title: Would've been happier if it hit him: Woman who threw shoe at Partha
379.article_body: A woman hurled a shoe at former West Bengal Minister Partha Chatterjee, who is an accused in the West Bengal School Service Commission scam, while he was being taken to the ED office on Tuesday. "I would have been happier if the shoe would have hit him on his head," she said when asked why she committed the act.

380.title: US House Speaker Pelosi lands in Taiwan despite Chinese warnings
380.article_body: US House of Representatives Speaker Nancy Pelosi reached Taiwan's Taipei on Tuesday, even as repeated warnings by China against the visit raised tensions between US and China. The top US official was reported to have been travelling in an Air Force aircraft which took off from Malaysia's Kuala Lumpur on Tuesday, although there was no official confirmation of the same.

381.title: Gyanvapi case lawyer Abhay Yadav passes away due to heart attack
381.article_body: Senior advocate Abhay Nath Yadav, who was representing the Anjuman Intezamia Masjid (AIM) committee in the Gyanvapi mosque case, died due to a heart attack on Sunday late night. Yadav was rushed to Trimurti Hospital in Uttar Pradesh's Varanasi, where doctors declared him dead upon arrival.

382.title: Vijay meets Salman, Chiranjeevi; says 'Your love for Liger means the world'
382.article_body: Vijay Deverakonda on Monday shared a post on Instagram thanking actors Chiranjeevi and Salman Khan for showering their blessings and love on his upcoming film 'Liger'. He also shared a picture wherein he could be seen standing next to Salman and Chiranjeevi. "Your blessings and love for #Liger mean the world to us! My respect and love always," Vijay wrote.

383.title: Our govt doing 'good work', cabinet expansion soon: Maha CM Shinde
383.article_body: Maharashtra Chief Minister Eknath Shinde on Tuesday said that his government is doing "good work" and assured that a cabinet expansion will take place soon. Speaking in Pune, Shinde said, "We have reduced VAT on petrol [and] diesel, provided relief to the farmers by resuming the scheme providing an assistance of ₹50,000, reduced power tariff for lift irrigation and others."

384.title: Traffic suspended on J&K's Mughal Road after landslide
384.article_body: Vehicular movement was suspended on J&K's Mughal Road on Tuesday after heavy rains and a landslide was reported in the Poonch district. Several hundred vehicles were stranded on the historic road as clearance operations were underway. The Mughal Road, which connects Poonch and Rajouri districts in Jammu with southern Kashmir, is an alternative to the Jammu-Srinagar National Highway.

385.title: 2 minor girls killed after house collapses in K'taka's Dakshina Kannada
385.article_body: Two minor girls were killed after their house collapsed on Monday following a landslide in the Parvathamukhi village in Karnataka's Dakshina Kannada district. "The bodies of two minor girls were recovered by National Disaster Mitigation Fund (NDMF) and State Disaster Mitigation Fund (SDMF) personnel," SP Rishikesh Sonawane said. Landslides in the district in early July had claimed three lives.

386.title: Corbevax recommended as booster for adults vaccinated with Covishield, Covaxin: Reports
386.article_body: A government panel has reportedly recommended allowing Corbevax as a precaution dose for adults fully vaccinated with either Covishield or Covaxin. Corbevax, which is India's first indigenously developed RBD protein subunit vaccine, is currently being used to vaccinate children between 12 and 14 years of age. At present, the booster dose is same as the one used for primary vaccination.

387.title: Preparations underway for manufacturing monkeypox vaccine: Poonawalla
387.article_body: Serum Institute of India CEO Adar Poonawalla on Tuesday said all preparations are underway for manufacturing a monkeypox vaccine. "I briefed [Union Health Minister Dr Mansukh Mandaviya] on this. We're researching on the monkeypox vaccine and if there's a need for it," Poonawalla added. Currently, the only licensed monkeypox vaccine is the one manufactured for smallpox by a Danish firm.

388.title: Uber turns its cash flow positive for the first time in Apr-Jun quarter
388.article_body: Uber has recorded positive quarterly cash flow for the first time ever in the April-June 2022 quarter, generating free cash flow of $382 million as trips exceeded pre-pandemic levels. The number of drivers and delivery agents on its platform also rose to an all-time high of almost five million. Uber's net loss in the quarter stood at $2.6 billion.

389.title: Child infected with Ebola-like Marburg virus passes away in Ghana
389.article_body: A World Health Organization (WHO) official on Tuesday said that a child who contracted the highly infectious Ebola-like Marburg virus in Ghana has died. The death brings the total number of fatalities in Ghana to three since the country registered its first ever outbreak of Marburg in July. Notably, three cases of Marburg have been detected in Ghana so far.

390.title: Ex-Pak PM Imran Khan's PTI received illegal foreign funds: Poll body
390.article_body: The Election Commission of Pakistan (ECP) unanimously said on Tuesday that ex-Pakistani PM Imran Khan's Pakistan Tehreek-e-Insaf (PTI) received illegal funding from 34 foreign individuals and businesses. The ECP in its verdict said that the party "willfully" received prohibited funding from countries including UAE, US, Canada and Australia. ECP launched a probe into PTI's funding sources in 2014.

391.title: I-T dept finds over ₹1,000 cr black income of Gujarat-based group
391.article_body: The Central Board of Direct Taxes on Tuesday said it found "unaccounted" income of over ₹1,000 crore in raids conducted on a Gujarat-based business conglomerate last month. Without naming the group, the CBDT said it has businesses in chemicals, textiles, real estate, packaging and education. The raids were conducted in Ahmedabad, Mumbai, Hyderabad and Kolkata.

392.title: Indian swimmers Page, Rawat enter men's 1500m freestyle final at CWG 2022
392.article_body: Indian swimmers Advait Page and Kushagra Rawat qualified for the men's 1500 metres freestyle final after finishing fourth in their respective heats at the Commonwealth Games in Birmingham on Tuesday. Page clocked 15:39.25 in the heat one, while Rawat had a timing of 15:47.77 in the heat two. The final will be held on Wednesday.

393.title: Govt acting upon political hatred & revenge: Congress on ED raids
393.article_body: The Congress party on Tuesday criticised the Centre over the Enforcement Directorate (ED) raids in around 14 locations in connection with the National Herald case. "This is the first time in independent India that the government is acting upon political hatred and revenge," Congress spokesperson Supriya Shrinate said. This is absolute rock bottom for Indian politics, she added.

394.title: Bill to make rail university autonomous introduced in Parliament
394.article_body: Education Minister Dharmendra Pradhan introduced the Central Universities (Amendment) Bill in Lok Sabha, which seeks to designate the National Rail and Transportation University as an autonomous central university. The bill intends to expand the university's scope to encompass the entire transport sector. "The proposed University will...go a long way in making the nation self-reliant," he said.

395.title: Govt polishing king's image as India battles unemployment: Rahul
395.article_body: India is battling an "epidemic of unemployment", but the government is spending billions just to polish the image of an "arrogant king", Congress leader Rahul Gandhi said on Tuesday. "We have to fight with every decree of the dictator, every attempt to suppress the voice of the people," Rahul said. Don't consider yourself alone, Congress is your voice, Gandhi added.

396.title: EV startup River raises $11 mn in Series A funding round
396.article_body: Electric vehicle startup River has raised $11 million in its Series A funding round. The round was led by Chris Sacca's Lowercarbon Capital, and saw participation from Toyota Ventures. The company, founded in 2020 by Aravind and Vipin George, plans to launch its first product by 2022 end or early 2023. The product is entirely built and designed in India.

397.title: World's most-tracked plane right now is US jet that may be carrying Pelosi to Taiwan
397.article_body: The most-tracked aircraft in the world right now is a US Air Force jet that took off from Kuala Lumpur, as internet users seek to track US House Speaker Nancy Pelosi on a possible trip to Taiwan. Almost 3,00,000 users are following every move of SPAR19, according to FlightRadar24. There is no official confirmation that Pelosi is on the plane.

398.title: ICC invited to make case for cricket's inclusion in 2028 Olympics: Reports
398.article_body: Cricket's apex body, ICC, has been invited to make a presentation advocating the inclusion of cricket in the 2028 Olympics in Los Angeles. Cricket will reportedly be competing for an Olympic spot with eight other disciplines, including lacrosse and baseball. "We are assisting the LA28 organisers and providing them with the information for their assessment," ICC chief Geoff Allardice said.

399.title: Edtech unicorn upGrad acquires test-prep platform Exampur
399.article_body: Edtech unicorn upGrad has acquired test-preparation platform for government jobs Exampur for an undisclosed amount. This is upGrad's third acquisition in a month after acquiring Harappa Education for ₹300 crore and recruitment firm Wolves India for an undisclosed amount. Exampur has a user base of over 10 million students and offers over 200 test-prep courses for government jobs.

400.title: 63-yr-old man, his son die of electrocution in UP's Ghazipur
400.article_body: Police on Tuesday said a father-son duo died after they were electrocuted in Uttar Pradesh's Ghazipur district. The incident took place on Monday, when 63-year-old Satish Narayan Malviya, a farmer, was bringing down clothes from a wire when his son, 28-year-old Ankit Malviya rushed to help him, police said. They were declared dead when taken to a community health centre.
